Image

Use the image component to display illustrations, graphics, drawings, photos, etc. on your site.

Installation 

                  
                    npm i @govflanders/vl-ui-image

or 

                  
                    yarn add @govflanders/vl-ui-image

Usage

Import SASS 

                  
                  @import "vl-ui-image/src/scss/image";

Make sure your sass --include-path includes node_modules/@govflanders/.

Image

Display an image

      
    <img
      itemprop="thumbnail"
      class="vl-image"
      src="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077"
      srcset="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077 1x, https://unsplash.it/512/350?image=1077 2x"
      alt="Autoloze zondag in Brussel"
      loading="" />

Image with caption

Add an optional caption that describes the image.

      
    <figure>
      <img
        itemprop="thumbnail"
        class="vl-image"
        src="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077"
        srcset="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077 1x, https://unsplash.it/512/350?image=1077 2x"
        alt="Autoloze zondag in Brussel"
        loading=""  />
      <figcaption class="vl-image__caption vl-annotation vl-u-text--small" itemprop="Autoloze zondag in Brussel">
        Autoloze zondag in Brussel
      </figcaption>
    </figure>

Image with lazyload

Add lazyload functionality to modern browsers (will be implemented in chrome 75). The lazyload attribute accepts 3 values: lazy, eager and auto. Eager will always load images right away, with auto your browser will determine whether or not to lazily load.

      
    <figure>
      <img
        itemprop="thumbnail"
        class="vl-image"
        src="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077"
        srcset="https://unsplash.it/256/175?image=1077 1x, https://unsplash.it/512/350?image=1077 2x"
        alt="Autoloze zondag in Brussel"
        loading="lazy"  />
      <figcaption class="vl-image__caption vl-annotation vl-u-text--small" itemprop="Autoloze zondag in Brussel">
        Autoloze zondag in Brussel
      </figcaption>
    </figure>

Accessibility

All informative images must have an alt text that describes the image. This allows users with a screenreader to access that information about the image. Purely decorative images can have an empty alt attribute.
